forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 52 overnight. West southwest wind 20 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 38 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Light Rain then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 10am. Mostly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 16 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As night falls over Downtown San Francisco, a curtain of rain descends softly upon the city, intermingling with the shadows of towering buildings. The clouds have woven themselves into a thick tapestry, obscuring the usually vibrant skyline, but there’s a certain beauty to the moody ambiance. Winds whip from the west, a brisk reminder of the season’s chill, carrying hints of moisture that dance in the air. While the moment may feel gloomy, it holds a serene promise of the city’s resilience against the elements.

Tomorrow, the sun will play coy, giving way to a few sunny intervals before succumbing to the chill of fading daylight. With temperatures hovering in the mid-fifties, one might consider layering up—an idea as practical as it is stylish. A light jacket paired with a cozy scarf would offer both comfort and warmth while you stroll along the quiet, rain-glazed streets. Should one seek pastime amid these wet conditions, perhaps find solace in a local café, savoring the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee while watching the waltz of raindrops against the window. For those enchanted by the city’s charm, a brief jaunt to the nearest bookstore could provide both distraction and delight, as you warm your spirit with literature before the day embarks on its inevitable twilight.
